items.content_html:
The documentation was stating the contrary of the actual encoding state. The fragment is percent-encoded, actually.

As described in the compatibility table, from Firefox 29 to Firefox 40, the returned value was incorrectly percent-decoded (i.e. not percent-encoded).

Firefox 29 was released on April 29, 2014. Firefox 41 was released on September 22, 2015. Now we are 8 years later.

Documentation page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAnchorElement/hash

Refs:

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Firefox/Releases/41#miscellaneous
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1093611
items.title: HTMLAnchorElement "hash" property: the fragment *is* percent-encoded

items.title: Updates for `DOMRectReadOnly`

items.content_html:
Description

Remove documentation about HTTP header X-XSS-Protection.

Motivation

X-XSS-Protection header was never standardized and was removed in favor of Content-Security-Policy, and was implemented only in Chromium and Edge, and was removed from them a long while ago (Chromium 78 (source) and Edge 17, according to BCD).

Additional details

  • Firefox never implemented this header. Firefox developer commented in 2018 that the feature is "not worth the effort" in Firefox.
  • Microsoft implemented it in IE and (the old Edge) but then removed it in 2018 (source)
  • Chromium implemented the header defaulting to blocking only the script which was suspected to be harmful, then privacy issues were found with that default, so Chromium changed the default to blocking the entire page load, then more issues were found and Chromium switched back, until finally removing the header support entirely in Chromium 78 (see source above).

Related issues and pull requests

TBD: link to BCD PR
items.title: Remove docs about HTTP header X-XSS-Protection

items.content_html:
Description

Now that "fast navigation" JS frameworks are becoming more common, clarify that mouseleave events will not be triggered when page content is replaced.

This can leave the application in an "undefined" state since not every mouseenter will have a corresponding mouseleave event.

Motivation

This subtle detail is often either overlooked or causes confusion.

Additional details

See eg.:

  • jquery - Mouseleave not triggered when element removed - Stack Overflow
  • javascript - mouseleave not firing after mouseenter changes HTML within anchor - Stack Overflow
  • javascript - Mouseleave not firing when creating an element below cursor in Webkit - Stack Overflow
  • 1465469 - mouseout and mouseleave should not be dispatched on removed DOM node
  • 515921 - Mouseleave fires on elements no longer in the DOM - chromium
  • 276329 - Mouseentermouseleave not triggered when element under cursor is removed or moved - chromium
  • 120786 – Mouseenter-leave not triggered when element under cursor is movedremoved
  • 515921 - Mouseleave fires on elements no longer in the DOM - chromium
items.title: Clarify `mouseleave` semantics on DOM removal

items.content_html:
CSpell has a clever mechanism to ignore \ in \network. With EscapeCharacters ignored the tool starts flagging etwork as a bad spelling.

Steps to reproduce

Open files/en-us/learn/mathml/first_steps/three_famous_mathematical_formulas/index.md in VSCode.

After applying the fix suggested in this PR the error goes away. Tested on the latest CSpell v8.0.0.

/cc @bsmth
items.title: fix(cspell): do not ignore escape characters

items.content_html:
Description

This pull request adds a footnote regarding Referer header specification. In practice, Referer can actually be modified, for example with the fetch() API using referer option.

Motivation

This pull request clears the confusion of immutability of forbidden header names and the actual behavior of Referer header.

Additional details

WHATWG Specification

Related issues and pull requests

Closes #29100
items.title: feat: add footnote regarding Referer mutability

items.content_html:
This matches the sentence on line 71

Description

The text says:

This is done by putting the namespace prefix and a colon before the parameter name as shown on the <script> element in the example above.

For this to be true, the script element in the example should use the xlink prefix even though these days it is not strictly necessary.

Since href is allowed on elements without the xlink namespace, perhaps a different example could be used? This fix is the smallest fix to bring example and text into alignment.

Motivation

Align example and explanation.

Additional details

none

Related issues and pull requests

none
items.title: Use the xlink prefix

items.content_html:
make huge change to Cookie Store API related pages

Description

add unwritten documentation for window.cookieStore ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.cookieStore ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.cookiechange ServiceWorkerRegistration.cookies, and add those properties to the API group data, also update them to api summary page

fix the incorrect event type in the Cookie Store API - Interfaces section - ExtendableCookieChangeEvent, which should fired at ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.cookiechange event, not change event

add partitioned parameter in CookieChangeEvent and ExtendableCookieChangeEvent properties values description

add a Instance methods section for CookieChangeEvent and ExtendableCookieChangeEvent

add a Event type section to CookieStore.change event

add {{optional_inline}} to CookieStore.get() CookieStore.getAll() CookieStore.delete(), as they are able to accept two types of parameters

update CookieStore.get() and CookieStore.set() parameters section by adding default value description

update CookieStore.get() CookieStore.getAll() CookieStore.delete() exception section

fix the example in CookieStore.get(), which return a Promise, and to get value must use await

fix the example in CookieStore.getAll(), which return a Promise resolves to an array, and to check if it is empty, we must check the length property of array

fix the parameters bug in CookieStore.delete(), that the options parameter can not accept a url parameter but should accept domain parameter

fix the incorrect apiref usage in CookieStoreManager pages

add {{AvailableInWorkers}} to CookieStore interface and CookieStoreManager interface (Except for
CookieStore.change event, which is only available in Window context)

make some style update and fix

Motivation

Additional details

reference to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cookie_Store_API

reference to https://wicg.github.io/cookie-store/

Related issues and pull requests

Relates to #29975 and #29461
items.title: update and fix to Cookie Store API
